article.title: Pion-less effective field theory for atomic nuclei and lattice nuclei

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the plot in Figure 1 show?
choices: The S-wave scattering lengths as a function of momentum.
The energy levels of the harmonic oscillator basis as a function of momentum.
The S-wave DVR basis functions as a function of momentum for a finite harmonic oscillator basis.
The momentum space matrix elements of the NN interaction for a finite harmonic oscillator basis.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main difference between the dashed red line and the solid blue line in Figure 2?
choices: The dashed red line represents the contact interaction in a finite harmonic oscillator basis without IR improvement, while the solid blue line represents the same with IR improvement.
The dashed red line represents the contact interaction in momentum space, while the solid blue line represents the same in the DVR basis.
The dashed red line represents the LO contact interaction, while the solid blue line represents the NLO contact interaction.
The dashed red line represents the NNN contact interaction, while the solid blue line represents the NN contact interaction.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 3 demonstrate about the IR improved DVR contact interaction?
choices: It is highly oscillatory and has significant deviations from the original interaction at low momenta.
It exhibits a strong cutoff dependence and its value at k=0 is significantly different from the original interaction.
It is smooth, almost constant at low momenta, and approaches zero at the UV cutoff of the finite harmonic oscillator basis.
It reproduces the effective range expansion of the NN interaction with high accuracy.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the solid blue line in Figure 4 represent?
choices: The NLO interaction term tailored to the finite harmonic oscillator basis through DVR with IR improvement.
The NLO interaction term in continuous momentum basis.
The NLO interaction term tailored to the finite harmonic oscillator basis through DVR without IR improvement.
The sharp cutoff Î› introduced by the finite harmonic oscillator basis.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 5 illustrate about the NLO interaction after IR improvement?
choices: The interaction has strong oscillations and incorrect behavior at low momenta.
The interaction accurately reproduces the effective range expansion for NN scattering.
The interaction matrix elements are smooth in momentum space and vanish smoothly at the UV cutoff.
The interaction is dominated by contributions from low momenta.
